name: Bava
description: Bava karana is ruled by Indra, the king of gods. It is favorable for activities requiring authority, leadership, and commanding presence. Business ventures and government-related work prosper during this karana.

name: Balava
description: Balava karana is governed by Brahma, the creator. It is highly favorable for creative pursuits, artistic endeavors, educational activities, and religious ceremonies. A time of creation and learning.

name: Kaulava
description: Kaulava karana is ruled by Mitra, the god of friendship. It is excellent for building relationships, forming partnerships, social gatherings, and any activity requiring cooperation and friendship.

name: Taitila
description: Taitila karana is governed by Vishnu, the preserver. It favors activities related to adornment, decoration, jewelry, and beautification. An excellent time for enhancing aesthetics and personal appearance.

name: Gara
description: Gara karana is ruled by Varun, the god of water and ocean. It is highly favorable for agricultural activities, farming, gardening, real estate dealings, and construction work. Earth-related ventures thrive.

name: Vanija
description: Vanija karana is governed by Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth. As the name suggests (Vanija = merchant), it is ideal for trade, commerce, business transactions, and all financial activities. Profits are indicated.

name: Vishti
description: Vishti karana, also known as Bhadra, is the only inauspicious movable karana. Ruled by Yama (god of death), it is considered highly unfavorable for auspicious activities. Only aggressive, defensive, or tantric activities may be performed.

name: Shakuni
description: Shakuni is the first fixed karana, occurring in Krishna Chaturdashi. Ruled by Garuda, it is suitable for activities related to medicine, healing, chemistry, and research. It has mixed auspiciousness.
occurrence: Once per lunar month (Krishna Chaturdashi, second half)

name: Chatushpada
description: Chatushpada is the second fixed karana, occurring in the first half of Amavasya. Named 'four-legged', it is favorable for work with animals, cattle, and agricultural activities. Movement is restricted.
occurrence: Once per lunar month (Amavasya, first half)

name: Naga
description: Naga is the third fixed karana, occurring in the second half of Amavasya. Associated with serpents, it favors permanent, stable, and long-term activities. Underground or foundational work is supported.
occurrence: Once per lunar month (Amavasya, second half)

name: Kimstughna
description: Kimstughna is the fourth and final fixed karana, occurring in the first half of Shukla Pratipada. It is the most auspicious among fixed karanas, ideal for religious activities, spiritual practices, and charitable deeds.
occurrence: Once per lunar month (Shukla Pratipada, first half)
